attributes.action: TAKE ACTION to prevent local councils robbing pensioners in sheltered housing for services they do not provide.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
10 years ago residents paid approx £18pw for the additional services provided in Sheltered Housing. 2 resident wardens resided on site 24/7.  Services have diminished and now only a part-time mobile warden with no weekend cover visits once a day - the cost still £18 pw. Yes they have intercom connection for emergency calls– on average 2 mins to respond – They pay extra for that service. The warden property is rented and generating additional income as is the community room - no reduction of fees and no income to support community functions. 

Even though they are being robbed blind their main concern is that they are no longer ‘sheltered’ from the harms that come with old age. For those with no family it could mean going from 11am on Friday to 11am on Monday without speaking to anyone. Is this really acceptable in 2009?

Please lobby for council’s to re-instate the full-time wardens that these people have been paying for so that they can thrive in their communities.

YOUR GRANDPARENT???
